name: Proxmox VM Autostart
description: Ensures critical VMs (IDs 101, 102, 200) are running; starts them if found stopped.
check_cmd: if command -v qm >/dev/null 2>&1; then if qm list | awk '/(101|102|200)/ && $3!="running" {exit 1}'; then echo ok; else echo fix; fi; else echo ok; fi
fix_cmd: if command -v qm >/dev/null 2>&1; then for id in $(qm list | awk '/(101|102|200)/ && $3!="running" {print $1}'); do qm start $id 2>/dev/null || true; done; fi
verify_cmd: sleep 5; if qm list | awk '/(101|102|200)/ && $3!="running" {exit 1}'; then echo ok; else echo fail; fi
